title: Two Sum
problemStatement:
Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target.

You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice.

You can return the answer in any order.
hints: Use a hash map to store the indices of the numbers you've already seen.
The time complexity should be O(n).

title: Reverse String
problemStatement:
Write a function that reverses a string. The input string is given as an array of characters s.

You must do this by modifying the input array in-place with O(1) extra memory.
hints: Use two pointers, one at the beginning and one at the end.
Swap the characters and move the pointers towards the center.

title: Container With Most Water
problemStatement:
You are given an integer array height of length n. There are n vertical lines drawn such that the two endpoints of the ith line are (i, 0) and (i, height[i]).

Find two lines that together with the x-axis form a container, such that the container contains the most water.

Return the maximum amount of water a container can store.
hints: Use two pointers starting at both ends of the array.
Move the pointer pointing to the shorter line inward.

title: Trapping Rain Water
problemStatement: Given n non-negative integers representing an elevation map where the width of each bar is 1, compute how much water it can trap after raining.
hints: Compute the maximum height to the left and right of each element.
The water trapped at each index is min(leftMax, rightMax) - height[i].
